title: New York City Faces Its Second Big Storm in Weeks
summary: The storm in late January was bad enough. This one is bringing true blizzard conditions, and the city has stepped up its response.

title: Killing of Cartel Boss Sets Off Chaos in Mexico, and Trump Has a New Plan for Tariffs
summary: Plus, a shooting at Mar-a-Lago.

title: Mexican Forces Kill ‘El Mencho,’ Nation’s Most-Wanted Cartel Boss
summary: “El Mencho” was the longtime head of one of the nation’s most powerful cartels. Armed groups set fire to cars and buildings across Mexico in the wake of his death.

title: Drug Lord ‘El Mencho’ Was Killed in Mexico. What’s Next for the Cartel He Led?
summary: The death of Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes dealt a major blow to the Jalisco New Generation Cartel, but few believe it spells the end for the powerful group.

title: What to Know About the Killing of ‘El Mencho’
summary: The Mexican government has killed Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, the longtime leader of one of Mexico’s most powerful gangs, the Jalisco New Generation Cartel.

title: For Iran’s Rulers, Refusing U.S. Demands Is a Risk Worth Taking
summary: The government in Tehran sees capitulating to Washington’s demands on uranium enrichment and ballistic missiles as riskier to its survival than going to war, analysts say.

title: Trump Considers Targeted Strike Against Iran, Followed by Larger Attack
summary: The top negotiators plan to meet in Geneva on Thursday for last-ditch talks, debating a new proposal that could create an off-ramp as two carrier groups massed within striking distance of Iran.

title: The Next Conflict
summary: We’re looking at the potential for a U.S. attack on Iran.

title: What’s Happened Since the Supreme Court’s Tariff Ruling
summary: After the Trump administration’s punishing tariffs were invalidated, the president said he would impose new tariffs using a different authority. It’s been a whirlwind.

title: Why the Supreme Court Struck Down Trump’s Tariffs
summary: Our reporter Ann E. Marimow describes the rationale of the Supreme Court’s 6-to-3 ruling to strike down President Trump’s sweeping tariffs.

title: U.K., Australia and Others Worse Off Under Trump’s New Tariffs
summary: Many important U.S. trading partners are facing higher duties after President Trump, reacting to a Supreme Court setback, set the rate on a new set of global tariffs at 15 percent.

title: Trump’s Challenge to Free Market Capitalism
summary: Stakes in private companies. Handshake deals with chief executives. The president’s economic policy has drifted far from principles that long defined the Republican Party. Is it capitalism at all?

title: Pizzoccheri Was Prominent at Winter Olympics in Italy
summary: Pizzoccheri, a hearty buckwheat pasta, graced restaurant menus and the athletes’ cafeterias. A chef hopes it can put a spotlight on the valley where it comes from.

title: Fact-check: Trump’s Latest Claims on Jobs, Inflation and Crime
summary: Trends on jobs, inflation and crime that began before Donald Trump retook office continued, largely unabated, in his first year back.

title: As Trump Touts Economic Gains, Many Workers Still Feel the Pinch
summary: President Trump says that he has brought down inflation, but families are still struggling to pay bills and plan for the future.

title: When Faced With Claims of Racism, Trump Points to His Black Friends
summary: President Trump has often invoked his unnamed Black friends, or name-checked celebrities and athletes, when asked to discuss anything related to Black voters.

title: Judges Grow Angry Over Trump Administration Violating Their Orders
summary: At least 35 times since August, federal judges have ordered the administration to explain why it should not be punished for violating their orders in immigration cases.

title: The Ukrainian Bureaucrat Working to Squeeze Russia’s War Machine
summary: Vladyslav Vlasiuk has spent the past four years pressing Western allies to squeeze the Russian economy through more sanctions. He hopes that 2026 will be the tipping point.

title: EU Support for Ukraine Stumbles as Hungary Looks to Delay Aid
summary: Hungary said that it would block both the latest sanctions package on Russia and a financial aid package to Kyiv worth about $106 billion.

title: ‘A.I. Literacy’ Is the New Drivers’ Ed at This Newark School
summary: Teachers say they want to equip high school students to drive artificial intelligence, rather than be mere passengers steered by chatbots.

title: ‘A.I. Literacy’ Is Trending in Schools. Here’s Why.
summary: Artificial intelligence companies are urging teachers to prepare students for an “A.I.-driven future.” What that means varies from school to school.

title: Supreme Court Considers Fate of Docks and Other Assets Seized by Cuba in 1960
summary: Amid rising tensions with Cuba, the Trump administration is backing lawsuits that would allow Americans to get compensation for property confiscated by Fidel Castro’s regime.

title: The Zero Units Fought for the C.I.A. in Afghanistan. In the U.S., They’re Living in Fear.
summary: A shooting in Washington, D.C., threw their immigration status into jeopardy — and brought attention to a long-hidden dimension of America’s war.

title: In Washington State, Democrats Consider Breaking a Taboo: Taxing the Rich
summary: The state where Jeff Bezos and Bill Gates made fortunes might have progressive social policies, but its resistance to an income tax is similar to conservative states. That might change.

title: BAFTAs 2026: The Best and Worst Moments
summary: Alan Cumming forced fishy British snacks onto movie stars. Paddington Bear presented an award. And there was more swearing, and racial curses, than this awards show has ever heard.

title: 2026 BAFTAs Winners: ‘One Battle After Another’ Wins Best Film, Besting ‘Sinners’
summary: Paul Thomas Anderson’s comedy drama won six awards at the British equivalent of the Oscars. The best actor choice, however, was a surprise.

title: The Human Cost of the Trump Administration’s War on Science
summary: The ripple effects of cutting H.I.V. research funding.

title: ‘The Pitt’ Is the Most Patriotic Show on Television
summary: An emergency room that’s a mirror.

title: Former F.B.I. Official, Ousted Under Trump, Will Run for Congress in Maryland
summary: David Sundberg, who led the Washington Field Office, is joining a crowded Democratic primary for Steny H. Hoyer’s open House seat.

title: Susan Sheehan, Pulitzer-Winning Chronicler of Lives on the Margins, Dies at 88
summary: As a journalist and author, she wrote meticulous portraits of people for The New Yorker. Her book “Is There No Place on Earth for Me?” won the Pulitzer Prize.

title: Hunter College to Review Professor’s ‘Abhorrent’ Remarks at Meeting
summary: A student objected to the potential closure of her New York City middle school. The professor, speaking on a hot mic, said, “They’re too dumb to know they’re in a bad school.” The comment was assailed as racist.

title: Duterte’s Fans Rally in The Hague as the I.C.C. Weighs Evidence Against Him
summary: The protests are a sign of the Philippine ex-leader’s ongoing influence, even as he faces a possible trial for the deaths of thousands during his war on drugs.
